00043 fsal_status_t FSAL_getattrs(
00044     fsal_handle_t         * p_filehandle,              /* IN */
00045     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,               /* IN */
00046     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_object_attributes        /* IN/OUT */
00047 )
00048 {
00049   fsal_status_t status;
00050 
00051   fsal_path_t               fsalpath;
00052   struct stat               buffstat;
00053 
00054   /* sanity checks.
00055    * note : object_attributes is mandatory in FSAL_getattrs.
00056    */
00057   if (!p_filehandle || !p_context || !p_object_attributes)
00058     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_getattrs);
00059 
00060   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_filehandle, 0, &fsalpath, &buffstat);
00061   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_getattrs);
00062   
00063   /* convert attributes */
00064                      
00065   status = posix2fsal_attributes( &buffstat,
00066                                  p_object_attributes );
00067   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00068   {
00069     FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes );
00070     FSAL_SET_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes,
00071         FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00072     Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_getattrs);
00073   }
00074   
00075   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_getattrs);
00076 
00077 }

00106 fsal_status_t FSAL_setattrs(
00107     fsal_handle_t         * p_filehandle,        /* IN */
00108     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,         /* IN */
00109     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_attrib_set,        /* IN */
00110     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_object_attributes  /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00111 ){
00112   
00113   int rc, errsv;
00114   unsigned int i;
00115   fsal_status_t         status;
00116   fsal_attrib_list_t    attrs ;
00117   
00118   fsal_path_t         fsalpath;
00119   struct stat         buffstat;
00120 
00121   /* sanity checks.
00122    * note : object_attributes is optional.
00123    */
00124   if (!p_filehandle || !p_context || !p_attrib_set)
00125     Return( ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_setattrs);
00126     
00127   /* local copy of attributes */  
00128   attrs = *p_attrib_set ;
00129   
00130   /* First, check that FSAL attributes changes are allowed. */
00131   
00132   /* Is it allowed to change times ? */  
00133   
00134   if ( !global_fs_info.cansettime ){
00135 
00136       if ( attrs.asked_attributes
00137            &
00138            ( FSAL_ATTR_ATIME | FSAL_ATTR_CREATION
00139             | FSAL_ATTR_CTIME | FSAL_ATTR_MTIME )
00140          )
00141       {
00142         /* handled as an unsettable attribute. */
00143         Return( ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0, INDEX_FSAL_setattrs );
00144       }
00145   }
00146   
00147     
00148   /* apply umask, if mode attribute is to be changed */
00149   if ( FSAL_TEST_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_MODE ) ){
00150      attrs.mode &= (~global_fs_info.umask) ;
00151   }
00152   
00153   /* convert handle into path */
00154   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_filehandle, 0, &fsalpath, &buffstat);
00155   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_setattrs);
00156 
00157   /***********
00158    *  CHMOD  *
00159    ***********/
00160   if ( FSAL_TEST_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_MODE ) )
00161   {
00162     
00163     /* The POSIX chmod call don't affect the symlink object, but
00164      * the entry it points to. So we must ignore it.
00165      */
00166     if ( ! S_ISLNK( buffstat.st_mode ) )
00167     {
00168       
00169       if ( p_context->credential.user != buffstat.st_uid ) Return( ERR_FSAL_PERM, 0, INDEX_FSAL_setattrs );
00170 
00171       TakeTokenFSCall();
00172       rc = chmod( fsalpath.path, fsal2unix_mode(attrs.mode) ); 
00173       errsv = errno;
00174       ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00175 
00176       if (rc) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_setattrs);
00177       
00178     }
00179         
00180   }
00181   
00182   /***********
00183    *  CHOWN  *
00184    ***********/
00185   /* Only root can change uid and A normal user must be in the group he wants to set */
00186   if ( FSAL_TEST_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_OWNER ) )
00187   {
00188     if(  (p_context->credential.user != 0) && 
00189          ( (p_context->credential.user != buffstat.st_uid ) ||
00190            (p_context->credential.user != attrs.owner )  ) )
00191        Return( ERR_FSAL_PERM, 0, INDEX_FSAL_setattrs );
00192   }
00193 
00194   if ( FSAL_TEST_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_GROUP ) )
00195   {
00196           
00197     if (p_context->credential.user != 0 && p_context->credential.user != buffstat.st_uid) Return( ERR_FSAL_PERM, 0, INDEX_FSAL_setattrs );
00198     int in_grp = 0;
00199     /* set in_grp */
00200     if (p_context->credential.group == attrs.group) in_grp = 1;
00201     else for (i=0; i < p_context->credential.nbgroups; i++) {
00202       if (in_grp = (attrs.group == p_context->credential.alt_groups[i])) break; 
00203     }
00204     if (p_context->credential.user != 0 && !in_grp) Return( ERR_FSAL_PERM, 0, INDEX_FSAL_setattrs );
00205   }
00206   
00207   if ( FSAL_TEST_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_OWNER | FSAL_ATTR_GROUP ) ) {
00208     TakeTokenFSCall();
00209     rc = lchown( fsalpath.path,
00210                  FSAL_TEST_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_OWNER ) ? (int) attrs.owner : -1,
00211                  FSAL_TEST_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_GROUP ) ? (int) attrs.group : -1  );
00212     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00213     if (rc) Return(posix2fsal_error(errno), errno, INDEX_FSAL_setattrs);
00214   }
00215    
00216   /***********
00217    *  UTIME  *
00218    ***********/
00219   if ( FSAL_TEST_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_ATIME | FSAL_ATTR_MTIME ) ) {
00220     
00221     struct utimbuf timebuf;
00222     
00223     /* check write permissions */
00224     status = fsal_internal_testAccess( p_context, FSAL_W_OK, &buffstat, NULL);
00225     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_setattrs);
00226     
00227     timebuf.actime = (FSAL_TEST_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_ATIME ) ? (time_t) attrs.atime.seconds : buffstat.st_atime);
00228     timebuf.modtime = (FSAL_TEST_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_MTIME ) ? (time_t) attrs.mtime.seconds : buffstat.st_mtime);
00229 
00230     TakeTokenFSCall();
00231     rc = utime(fsalpath.path, &timebuf);
00232     errsv = errno;
00233     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00234     if (rc) Return(posix2fsal_error(errno), errno, INDEX_FSAL_setattrs);
00235     
00236   }
00237     
00238   /* Optionaly fills output attributes. */
00239   
00240   if ( p_object_attributes )
00241   {
00242     status = FSAL_getattrs( p_filehandle, p_context, p_object_attributes );
00243 
00244     /* on error, we set a special bit in the mask. */        
00245     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00246     {
00247       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes );
00248       FSAL_SET_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes,
00249           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00250     }
00251     
00252   }
00253   
00254   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_setattrs);
00255   
00256 }
